SupportingTexts.HomePageText: Run and explore DocuSign eSignature API code examples with Authorization Code Grant or JWT Grant authentication
SupportingTexts.CFRError: This example is not compatible with your CFR Part 11 account. Please return to the homepage to run one of the examples that is compatible or authenticate with a different account.

LoginPage.LoginHeader: Please Authenticate with DocuSign
LoginPage.LoginHelperText: You need to authenticate with DocuSign to continue your request.

SelectAPIPage.SelectAPIHeader: Please choose an API type

HelpingTexts.EmailWontBeShared: We'll never share your email with anyone else.
HelpingTexts.PhoneNumberWontBeShared: We'll never share your phone number with anyone else.
HelpingTexts.CCEmailShouldDifferFromSigner: The email for the cc recipient must be different from the signer's email.
HelpingTexts.AccessCodeText: Provide this string to a recipient that is different such as in person or by mail or via different email.
HelpingTexts.CountryCodeText: The country code for the phone below
HelpingTexts.ChooseDateInTheFuture: Please choose a date in the future
HelpingTexts.PhoneNumberWillBeNotified: This phone number will receive a notification.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with a remote (email) signer and cc recipient
Examples.ExampleDescription: The envelope includes a pdf, Word, and HTML document. Anchor text(AutoPlace) is used to position the signing fields in the documents.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature through your app (embedded signing)
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends an envelope, then uses embedded signing for the first signer. With embedded signing, DocuSign signing is initiated from your website.

Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature through your app (embedded signing) with a CFR Part 11 account
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends an envelope, then uses embedded signing with recipient authentication by phone for the first signer. With embedded signing, DocuSign signing is initiated from your website.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope using a template
Examples.ExampleDescription: The envelope is defined by the template. The signer and cc recipient name and email are used to fill in the template's roles.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please first create the template using Create a template.

Forms.FormName:
The template you created via Create a template will be used.
The document list is from your results for List an envelope's documents.

Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Embedded Signing Ceremony from a template with an added document
Examples.ExampleDescription:
This example sends an envelope based on a template.

In addition to the template's document(s), the example adds an additional document to the envelope by using the Composite Templates feature.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please first create the template using Create a template.

Forms.FormName: The template you created via Create a template will be used.

Examples.ExampleName: Request a signature by SMS delivery
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends a signature request via an SMS message.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with an order form and payment field
Examples.ExampleDescription: Anchor text (AutoPlace) is used to position the fields in the documents.
Examples.Notes: Note: This example will only work if the sender's DocuSign account is set up with a DocuSign payment gateway. Since the Payment Gateway ID is set in the configuration file, you will need to run your own instance of this project to set it.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please set the DS_PAYMENT_GATEWAY_ID value in the configuration file.

Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope to an In Person Signer
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to host an In Person Signing session with embedded signing.

Examples.ExampleName: Get an envelope's basic information and status
Examples.ExampleDescription: List the basic information about an envelope, including its overall status. Additional API/SDK methods may be used to get additional information about the envelope, its documents, recipients, etc.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText:
Problem: please first create an envelope using Send an envelope with a remote (email) signer and cc recipient.
You will then need to use List an envelope's documents to create the list of documents.
Thank you.

Examples.ExampleDescription: List the envelopes created in the last 30 days.

Examples.ExampleName: Create a template
Examples.ExampleDescription: Create a template with two roles, signer and cc.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Template name: {0}, ID {1}.

Examples.ExampleName: Embedded sending
Examples.ExampleDescription: An envelope will be created in draft mode. The DocuSign web tool (NDSE) will then be shown, enabling further updates to the envelope before it is sent.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Sender view URL: {0}

Examples.ExampleName: Bulk send envelopes
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to send envelopes in bulk to multiple recipients. First, this example creates a bulk-send recipients list, then creates an envelope. After that, it initiates bulk envelope sending.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from BulkSend:getBulkSendBatchStatus method:

Examples.ExampleName: Pause a signature workflow
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example creates and envelope and then pauses the signature workflow.
Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from the Envelopes::create method:

Examples.ExampleName: Unpause a signature workflow
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example unpauses a signature workflow for the previously created envelope that was paused.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please first create an envelope with a paused signature workflow using Pause a signature workflow.

Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from the Envelopes::update method:

Examples.ExampleName: Use conditional recipients
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to create an envelope where the workflow is routed to different recipients based on the value of a transaction.

CustomErrorTexts.ErrorMessage: Update to the workflow with recipient routing is not allowed for your account! Please contact with our support team to resolve this issue.

Examples.ResultsPageText: Envelope ID {0} with conditional routing criteria has been created and sent to the first recipient!

Examples.ExampleName: Schedule an envelope
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to schedule an envelope using the scheduled sending feature.

The envelope has been created and scheduled!

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with delayed routing
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to delay an envelopeâ€™s delivery between recipients using the delayed routing feature.

Examples.ExampleName: List an envelope's documents
Examples.ExampleDescription: List the envelope's documents. A Certificate of Completion document is also associated with every envelope.

Examples.ExampleDescription: An envelope's documents can be downloaded one by one or as a complete set.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope using binary document transfer
Examples.ExampleDescription:
The envelope includes a pdf, Word, and HTML document.

Multipart data transfer is used to send the documents in binary format to DocuSign. Binary transfer is 33% more efficient than base64 encoding and is recommended for documents over 15M Bytes. Binary transfer is not yet supported by the SDK.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Create a signable HTML document
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to create an HTML document for responsive signing.

Examples.ExampleName: Set document visibility for envelope recipients
Examples.ExampleDescription: Demonstrates how to set document visibility for envelope recipients.

CustomErrorTexts.ErrorMessage: See How to set document visibility for envelope recipients in the DocuSign Developer Center for instructions on how to enable document visibility in your developer account.

Examples.ResultsPageText: The envelope has been created and sent! Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Get the tab data from an envelope
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example retrieves the tab (field) values from an envelope.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please first create an envelope using Send an envelope using a template.

Forms.FormName: The last envelope you created with this example launcher will be queried. Recommendation: Use Send an envelope using a template, then this example, since Send an envelope using a template includes many tabs of different types.

Examples.ResultsPageText: Results from the Envelopes::get method:

Examples.ExampleName: Set tab values for a envelope
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example sets the tab (field) values for an envelope including tabs that can and cannot be changed by the signer.

Examples.ExampleName: Set template tab values
Examples.ExampleDescription: This example sets the tab (field) values for a template being used by an envelope.

RedirectsToOtherCodeExamples.RedirectText: Prerequisite: Please first create the template using Create a template.

Examples.ExampleDescription: This example lists the envelope's custom metadata field values.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with ID Verification Authentication
Examples.ExampleDescription: Submit an envelope that requires verification of a government issued identity.
Examples.Notes: Note: The access code for this example is the Signer Name.

CustomErrorTexts.ErrorMessage: Please contact Support to enable IDV in your account.

Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Send an envelope with Recipient Knowledged Based Authentication
Examples.ExampleDescription: Submit an envelope with multiple choice, public records based questions to provide multi-factor authentication.
Examples.Notes: Note: The access code for this example is the Signer Name.
Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
Envelope ID {0}.

Examples.ExampleName: Require Phone Authentication for a Recipient
Examples.ExampleDescription: Sends an envelope that requires entering a six-digit code from a text message or phone call for the purpose of multifactor authentication.

CustomErrorTexts.ErrorMessage: Please contact Support to enable recipient phone authentication in your account.

Examples.ResultsPageText:
The envelope has been created and sent!
